Name: Amulet scarab
Description: Mummy scarabs were only used in the funerary cult and probably only from the Late Period onwards. They are special in that they depict a fully carved beetle. The underside is not smooth and inscribed, as with seal scarabs, but shows the legs of the animal. Another important feature is the loop on the underside, which is often not even pierced. The amulet was simply placed on the mummy. There seem to have been no rules about which material to be used. This scarab is made of lapis lazuli.
